list_definition.definition: to wash (clothes etc) in clean water to remove soap etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was rinsing a plate under the tap.

list_definition.definition: to clean (a cup, one’s mouth etc) by filling with clean water etc and then emptying the water out

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The dentist asked me to rinse my mouth out.

list_definition.definition: a liquid used for changing the colour of hair

list_ex_of_english: They were repeatedly rinsed to neutrality and subsequently given a hot alkali soaking to remove humic acids.
In order to avoid manual transfer of electrolytes, rubber surgical gloves that were previously rinsed in distilled water were used for handling the kernels.
All collecting implements were thoroughly scrubbed between each sample using fresh water and a mild detergent before twice rinsing in distilled water.
The 48 stalls kept water in buckets for rinsing hands and tableware, reusing the same water several times during the day.
Eyes were then rinsed, dehydrated, and embedded in paraffin.
The buccal cavity was rinsed and the opercula and eyes were examined.
The floating inflorescence remainders were decanted off, and the seeds were rinsed in distilled water.
Cages were washed with soap and rinsed with clean water between trials to remove any residues from the previous treatment.
